Package ui.game

Class Hand

  • java.lang.Object
    • ui.drawing.DrawableSection
      • ui.input.selection.DrawableSelectableSection
        • ui.input.selection.SelectableGrid<Piece,​BufferedSectionComposer<SelectableBufferedSection>,​SelectableBufferedSection>
          • ui.game.Hand
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    PrintHandler, Section, SelectableSection, SelectionHandler
    public class Hand
extends SelectableGrid<Piece,​BufferedSectionComposer<SelectableBufferedSection>,​SelectableBufferedSection>
    Represents a player's hand.
    A selectable grid of sections built upon a SectionGrid. Sections can be moved between using the movement keys.
    Represents a selectable section that can be drawn to the terminal window.
    Represents a section that can be drawn to the terminal window.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Hand

        public Hand​(Game game,
            boolean flipped,
            TerminalHandler terminalHandler,
            EscapeHandler escapeHandler,
            boolean enabled)
        Constructor for Hand.
        Parameters:
        game - The game the hand belongs to.
        flipped - If the hand is the opposite player to usual (e.g player 2 has right hand).
        terminalHandler - The TerminalHandler.
        escapeHandler - The escape handler.
        enabled - If the hand is enabled for selection.

    • Method Detail

      • getGrid

        private static SectionGrid<Piece,​BufferedSectionComposer<SelectableBufferedSection>,​SelectableBufferedSection> getGrid​(Game game)
        Sets up the underlying section grid.
        Parameters:
        game - The game the hand will belong to.
        Returns:
        The section grid.

      • updateHand

        public void updateHand​(java.util.List<Piece> pieces,
                       boolean enabled,
                       Piece selectable,
                       boolean pieceFlipped)
        Re-renders the hand with the correct number of pieces. The pieces are drawn in order.
        Parameters:
        pieces - The pieces to draw.
        enabled - If all pieces should be enabled for selection/
        selectable - One piece that should be selectable.
        pieceFlipped - If the piece should have its move directions inverted.
